commands.name: az network route-table create
commands.syntax:
az network route-table create --name
                              --resource-group
                              [--disable-bgp-route-propagation {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--location]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--tags]
examples: az network route-table create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteTable

commands.name: az network route-table delete
commands.syntax:
az network route-table delete [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--subscription]
examples: az network route-table delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteTable

commands.name: az network route-table show
commands.summary: Get the details of a route table.
examples: az network route-table show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteTable

commands.name: az network route-table update
commands.syntax:
az network route-table update [--add]
                              [--disable-bgp-route-propagation {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ids]
                              [--name]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--remove]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--set]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--tags]
examples: az network route-table update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteTable --disable-bgp-route-propagation true

commands.name: az network route-table wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
